projects.description: This project is an employee directory for a fictional company. It uses Fetch API to request data from the Random User Generator API. The JSON object from the API is parsed and a card is created for each employee with basic contact information. Clicking on an employee’s card will display a modal window with additional information. Within the modal window, employees can be toggled through continuously without having to exit the modal. The list of employees can be filtered using the search field.

This project is a browser-based phrase guessing game, created using JavaScript and Object-Oriented Programming. After clicking the Start Game button, the game board is revealed with a randomly selected phrase. The user guesses a letter by either clicking on the onscreen keyboard or by pressing the selected letter on their own keyboard, disabling that letter for future guesses. If the selected letter matches a letter in the phrase, the matching letter(s) in the phrase are revealed. If the selected letter does not match a letter in the phrase, one of the user’s five hearts is removed. The player keeps guessing either until they guess all the letters and win, or they use up all of their hearts and lose the game.

This project uses unobtrusive JavaScript and jQuery to add dynamic and conditional functionality to a registration form. The entire form is checked for validity and completeness. If any errors are found, the form will not submit and the corresponding error messages will be displayed. If all fields are valid, an alert displays informing the user that the registration was successfully submitted.

This project uses unobtrusive JavaScript to dynamically add pagination links to a long list of students, displaying only ten students per page. This will work for a list of any length.  A search feature is added to allow users to find full or partial matches to their search. The pagination links are updated based on the search results.

This is the first project I have ever created. Using JavaScript, a random quote and color is displayed each time the user clicks the button. It also has an interval timer that will automatically change the quote and color every ten seconds.
